data.title: Masood Ahmed
data.meta_description: Masood Ahmed is the father of Syed, Shabnam, Tamwar and Kamil Masood and the ex husband of Zainab Khan. He is also the brother of AJ and Inzamam Ahmed and is portrayed by Nitin Gantara. Masood was born in Pakistan on 4th April 1961, but his family came to England when he was a baby in 1962. At...
data.text:
Masood Ahmed is the father of Syed, Shabnam, Tamwar and Kamil Masood and the ex husband of Zainab Khan. He is also the brother of AJ and Inzamam Ahmed and is portrayed by Nitin Gantara.

Backstory[]

Masood was born in Pakistan on 4th April 1961, but his family came to England when he was a baby in 1962. At some point in the early 1980's he met Zainab Khan, who was married to Yusef Khan, Masood and Zainab began an affair which culminated in Zainab leaving Yusef for Masood, which lead to Yusef setting Zainab on fire as revenge. Masood managed to save Zainab from burning to death, Masood and Zainab then had three children together (at the time) before moving to England to set up local businesses.

Storylines[]

2007-2009: Arrival and financial troubles[]

Masood, along with his wife Zainab, and their children Shabnam and Tamwar, move the square in October 2007, it is revealed that Masood is a postman while Zainab was the owner of a chain of post offices. Masood goes to Pakistan to look after his sick father, and when he returns, he discovers that the rest of his family are in serious debt and are forced to close the post office. However, they lie to the residents of the Square by telling them that the government forced them to shut down, but soon they are forced to reveal the truth when the residents start protesting. In an attempt to turn their fortunes round, the Masood’s start a catering business. Ian Beale invests £2000 and the company merges with Ian and Christian Clarke's catering business and the company is named "Masala Queen". However, Zainab soon accuses Masood of stealing money from the business, but Tamwar admits he has been taking the money and giving it to his brother, Syed Masood. Masood is angry at this since Syed had stolen money from their business before, which was why he left the family before. Despite this, Zainab visits her son, but Masood thinks she is having an affair. When the truth is revealed, Masood lets Syed move to the square, where he is engaged to Amira Shah.

Masood plans to take Zainab on a trip around the world, but Zainab tells her husband that she is pregnant, stopping the plans. In order to earn extra income and money, Masood works an extra shift at the taxi firm, depite being exhausted. One time during his job he is driving Rachel Branning home, but he falls asleep at the wheel and crashes the taxi. PC Henderson questions Masood about the incident and Amira lies by saying he swerved to avoid someone on a moped. The police leave and Amira tells Masood she does not want two fathers in prison, but Masood still regrets lying to the police.

2010: Syed and Amira's wedding[]

Before Syed and Amira's wedding, Masood visits his brother Inzamam to ask for help in paying for the wedding. However, Zainab reveals to Masood that Inzamam has made advances at her in the past many times. Because of this, Masood tells Inzamam his money is no longer needed and he and his family are no longer welcome at his home. A month before the wedding, Masood is still unaware that there are problems in Syed and Amiras's relationship, during this time Zainab also goes into labour and Masood delivers the baby, who they name Kamil. But more problems arise as Masood's line manager David Hensler arrives with a colleague, saying there has been an allegation of stolen post, and they must search the house. During the search, they find a package of Max Branning's, and Masood receives a caution.

Just before the wedding, Masood walks in on Syed and Christian kissing on the floor of Syed and Amiras' new flat and he quickly leaves. When Syed admits to his parents that his gay, Masood attempts to convince Syed that he has a loving wife, but Syed ignores this, and leaves his home. Because of this, Masood believes that he is no longer part of the family, and doesn't even want to hear his name (but Zainab misses him dearly). Amira's father Qadim Shah arrives in Walford looking for Syed, and after Qadim and his associates beat Christian up, Christian sees Masood outside and begs for help, but Masood leaves him. The next day, Masood regrets his actions, saying he should've helped Christian. Jane reveals that Zainab knew about Syed's sexuality before even the wedding, which causes Masood and Zainab to have an argument, he packs her bags and physically throws her out. Masood and Zainab eventually reconile, and they both forgive Syed and allow him to move into the family home. However, Syed eventually reunites with Christian, and Masood and Zainab cut off their son again.

2010-2011: Rivalry with Yusef and divorce from Zainab[]

Masood's son, Tamwar, starts dating Afia Khan, and her father, Yusef, turns up at the square, which shocks Zainab as he was her ex-husband, whose family set her on fire. He reveals he tried to save Zainab from the fire, and that he came to make peace, but Masood attacks Yusef and throws him out. Masood discovers that Zainab is planning to buy The Argee Bhajee]] restaurant against his wishes, Masood meets with Jane and they console each other about their partners. Realising their feelings for each other, they meet at hotel and are about to have sex. However, they both change their minds and decide to remain friends. Meanwhile Zainab continues to defy Masood and proceeds with her bid for the restaurant, but she is unsuccessful, but only paying an inflated price for it. Feeling guilty, Masood supports her purchase.

Ian learns of Masood and Jane's encounter, and confronts him, punching Masood in the face. Tamwar invites Afia to the opening of the Argee Bhajee. Masood and Zainab approve of Tamwar and Afia dating each other, in the hope it will frizzle out, but when Tamwar proposes to Afia and Yusef gives them his blessing, the parents are displeased as they do not want Yusef in the family. After the roof of the Argee Bhajee collapses, they are forced to shut it down and the Masoods find themselves in debt, desperate for money, Masood receives a loan Phil Mitchell, for Tamwar's wedding, but when Zainab finds out, she is furious. Masood then admits he is gambling money by playing poker for Phil in an effort to pay their debt, this angers Zainab as Masood had perviously sworn that he would never gamble again, as Masood lost family money to gamlbing before.

Masood kidnaps Yusef in an attempt to scare him off after he has been getting close to Zainab, but when Yusef returns to Zainab and the family, he lies and says that Masood beat him and covered him in petrol, Masood pleads his innocence but Zainab doesn't believe Masood and kicks him out, and tells him he is banned from Tamwar and Afias' wedding.

At the mehndi, Afia's aunt tells everyone that Yusef and Zainab are having an affair, having misunderstood and overheard conversation, and Zainab denies this. Zainab invites Masood to dinner, and there is a chance that the two might reunite, until Denise Fox reveals that Yusef stayed at Zainab's house overnight, making Masood leave, as part of his plan to destroy the Masood family, Yusef crushes up a bottle of pills and hides them in Zainab's food. Zainab passes out when she eats the food and is taken to hospital, with her family believing she took an overdose on purpose. Concerned that he is causing Zainab's worries, Masood divorces Zainab.

Yusef persuades Zainab to go on holiday with him to Pakistan, and while they are away, Amira returns with her and Syed's daughter, Yasmin. Masood is delighted to learn that he is a grandfather, and vows to reunite and repair his family, especially when it is revealed that Yusef falsified a paternity test to show that Syed is not Yasmin's father. Despite this, Masood sees Zainab talking to Yusef, and Masood says that he has given up on her. Yusef later tells Masood that he has moved in with Zainab. Angry and upset, Masood goes to Jane (who has returned to divorce Ian) and tells her he doesn't want to stay just as friends, and kisses her, and the pair begin a relationship.

On the day Masood and Zainab's divorce finalised, Syed and Amira spot Masood with Jane. Zainab hears of this, and while she wishes Masood luck, she tells him that she and Yusef are going to marry. Masood is shocked, but supports her decision. When Yusef tells Masood and Jane about them taking Kamil to Pakistan, Zainab and Jane argue, later Masood and Jane go to dinner at Ian and Mandy's house. At the dinner, Ian questions Masood's relationship and whether he is allowed to develop his relationship with Jane since she is not a Muslim. A drunken Jane announces that she will convert to Islam, but Masood tells Jane of the sacrifices she will make, and does not expect her to convert, Jane is relieved and decides not to convert.

A few weeks later, Masood finds a letter from Zainab asking for help, and discovers that Yusef has kidnapped Kamil. He plots with Zainab to stop Yusef taking her to Pakistan, and eventually tracks down Kamil. The police are called on Yusef, but Afia lets him escape to the B+B where Masood stays during a party. At the party Yusef reveals to Masood that it was indeed him that started the fire on Zainab, before attacking Masood, knocking him out. Yusef then sets the B+B on fire. The two try to escape, but only Masood makes it out alive. Masood and Zainab then reunite.

2012-2016: Break up with Zainab, drinking/gambling problems and Zaiir's death[]

Masood and Zainab get engaged after moving past the chaos that Yusef caused, Masood discovers that Syed is having an affair with Danny Pennant behind Christian's back, Masood questions if Syed is marrying the right man, despite Christian finding out him and Syed still get married.

Zainab's friend Ayesha Rana stays at her and Masood's house, Zainab attempts to get her to date her son Tamwar, but Ayeesha develops romantic feelings for Masood, she attempts to seduce him but Masood rejects her. Zainab purchases an expensive fountain to give the impression her family are not poor, however she is extremely protective of the fountain and when Tiffany and Morgan Butcher vandalise the fountain, Zainab believes it was Masood, she is also frustrated with him for not attending a meeting with his mom and Zainab, after an explosive argument Masood smashes Zainab's fountain in frustration. When Masood calms down he later tells Zainab he is unhappy in their relationship and calls off their wedding, Zainab says she has always loved Masood over their marriage, but admits to her role in the breakdown of their relationship, she and Kamil then leave, returning to Pakistan.

Masood begins dating Carol Jackson after splitting up from Zainab, they go on several dates, Carol decides to reunite with her ex boyfriend David Wicks, Masood begins to develop a gambling and alcohol addiction, losing Tamwar's money during a poker game with Alfie Moon. Masood lets Fatboy take the blame, however Tamwar eventually discovers this and after confronting Masood, the pair argue and Masood punches Tamwar, Masood continues to heavily drink, even throwing a drink over Tamwar and attempting to fight David in jealous rage, Fatboy tells Shabnam what has transpired and she comes back to Walford.

Masood and Jane begin to date again, Shabnam tries to get Jane back with her ex-husband Ian, as she doesn't approve of her and Masood's relationship, Jane and Ian sleep together after Ian's daughter Lucy Beale is murdered, Masood and Jane subsequently break up. Shabnam gets engaged to longterm partner Kush Kazemi, but suffers a heartbreaking still birth when her and Kush's son Zaiir Kazemi passes away, Shabnam is shocked when she discovers Masood is seeing Kush's mother Carmel Kazemi, Masood discovers that Zainab is not attending Shabnam and Kush's wedding, Masood goes to Pakistan to bring Kamil to attend the wedding and he informs Tamwar that Zainab is intending to cut ties with the family.

Word gets out that Kush had an affair with Stacey Slater and is the father of Arthur Fowler Jr, Masood punches Kush and breaks up with Carmel after discovering Carmel knew about the affair. Shabnam leaves Walford unable to face Kush, Masood discovers that Zainab is getting married in Pakistan and she wants Tamwar and Kamil to attend, sending him money for plane tickets. Masood gives the money to Tamwar, who is planning to travel with his girlfriend Nancy Carter, Nancy and Tamwar then leave and go travelling. When Denise Fox falls pregnant she tells Masood the father is Phil, leaving Masood shocked, he asks Denise how Phil manages to get "all these women", Masood ultimately agrees to not tell anyone.

Masood goes travelling with Kamil and is intending to go for ten months but returns three weeks later, after Kamil gets home sick, when returning Masood realises that Carmel and her youngest son Shakil Kazemi has moved into his house, Masood moves in but him and Carmel frequently argue, Carmel calls Masood a bad influence on Shakil. Masood later begins a relationship with Belinda Peacock, when attempting to help her salon business, "Elysium", out of financial difficulty. They later agree they are attracted to each other, but she wants him to invest money so he makes her choose either the money or a relationship, she decides to go for the latter. Carmel and Belinda's cousin, Stacey, disapproves of the relationship, thinking Masood is having a midlife crisis. Masood hears that Zainab is getting divorced and calls her to see how she is doing and he books two tickets to Pakistan, while Belinda leaves Walford to go travelling with a friend. Carmel tries to stop Masood leaving but he insists he is doing what is best for Kamil. Denise is against him leaving and they have a falling out, but Carmel warns her not to let things end badly, so they make amends. Masood says goodbye to his friends and leaves Walford with Kamil, with Jane saying they will always be here if he needs them. He and Kamil then leave, returning to Pakistan and then going travelling to varios countries including Egypt.

2017-2019: Return and relationship with Kathy Beale[]

Masood returns on 28 November 2017. He has returned to notify Carmel that he will not be renewing her tenancy at 41 Albert Square, to allow his aunt and uncle Mariam and Arshad Ahmed to move in. in doing so he makes himself homeless as he cannot get his businesses up and running again, Masood manages to get a job at The Queen Victoria, he walks into the gents toilet and catches a customer taking drugs, the customer punches Masood and walks off, Masood then quits his job at the Vic when Arshad finds out he is a barman. In January 2018, Masood secures a job at the laundrette, however Karen walks in, thinking she secured the job. Mr. Papadopolous tells them that he will give them both a trial, whoever does the best job, gets the job.

Masood goes into business with Ian at Walford East, after Ian accidentally hands Masood's business plans to the woman investing in the business. Masood confronts Ian after discovering this, however the the woman offers double the money for them as equal partners, to which they both agree. Ian is left furious when he catches Masood and Kathy kissing in the Walford East kitchen during it's relaunch, Ian and Masood then begin to food fight which is caught on camera by a Walford Gazette photographer.

Kathy and Masood split up after a few months, after Masood tells her he wants emigrate to Australia, something Kathy does not want to do as she wants to stay with her family, Kathy and Masood share one final kiss before Masood leaves. In February 2019 Masood gives his business to nieces Iqra and Habiba Ahmed and leaves Walford.

In July 2024 Jane returns after Ian contacts her to reconnect her and Bobby, the Beale’s then go to Jane's house for a brief reunion. When the Beale’s leave Jane has a phone call with Masood and it's implied that they are back in a relationship .

Employment history[]

Occupation Years Active Postman Prior to 2007-2011 Employee/Manager at the Post Office 2007-2008 Owner of The Argee Bhajee 2011-2012 Chef/Waiter at Walford East (Restaurant) 2014-2016 Co Owner of Masala Masood 2015-2016 Barman at The Queen Victoria 2018 Chef/Co Owner of Walford East (Restaurant) 2018-2019

Residence[]

Address Years Pakistan Prior to 2007, 2015-2016, 2019 41 Albert Square 2007-2019 (still owned by Masood) Various countries 2016-2017 Egypt 2017 Australia 2019 to ??

Quotes[]

To Kevin Wicks (first line): "Lovely weather for the race."

To Yusef Khan: "Losing her twice, to the same man."

To Yusef: "I don't hate you, i pity you, because even after everything you've done she still chose me."

To Denise Fox (after discovering she is pregnant with Phil Mitchell's baby): "Phil Mitchell, Phil Mitchell!"

To Habiba and Iqra Ahmed (last line): "Okay, look after the house for me and if you do run the restaurant into the ground, send me a picture."

Background information[]

In 2022, Masood's actor Nitin Ganatra controversially claimed EastEnders could struggle to last for the next fourty years if it does not get a new gutsy and courageous team and bring the show back to it's old roots.

Masood was the longest running Asian character in EastEnders.

See also[]
